title: How to Install a Reverse Osmosis Permeate Pump

steps.headline: Install permeate pump mounting clip onto the RO system manifold
steps.description: If the RO manifold is not pre-drilled for the permeate pump mounting clip, it will be necessary to drill the manifold to hold the mounting clip in place. Hold the mounting clip in the desired location (the tubing lengths provided in these instructions apply when the pump is mounted on the front/left of the RO manifold) and use a permanent marker to mark the hole locations. The mounting clip should have included mounting screws. Use the appropriate sized drill bit to drill the holes in the manifold. NOTE:  To avoid damaging the filter sump located behind the new hole locations, remove the filter sumps before drilling.

steps.headline: Slide the pump into the mounting clip from the side.
steps.description: Ensure that you have the “Brine Out” and the “Permeate Out” ports toward the top of the pump.

steps.headline: Turn the entire system around so that the back of the RO systems is facing you.
Remove both end of the tubing that runs from the permeate port of the membrane housing to ASO (Auto Shut-Off) valve.
steps.description: In order to remove the tubing from the Push-In connector, you need to press and hold in the collet ring and simultaneously pull out the tubing. NOTE:  Forcibly removing the tubing without holding in the collet ring is likely to damage the connector or the tubing, or both. This could cause leaks.

steps.headline: Insert one end of a 22” section of tubing into the permeate port of the membrane housing, and run the tubing around to the front of the system and insert the other end of the tubing into the “Permeate In” port of the pump.
Attach an elbow stem fitting (facing up) into the “Permeate Out” port of the pump.
Insert one end of a 15” section of tubing into the elbow stem fitting of the “Permeate Out” port of the pump, and insert the other end of the tubing into the open port of the ASO valve

Locate the flow restrictor, and insert one end of a 22” section of tubing into the flow restrictor, and run the tubing around to the front of the system (using the guide holes in the mounting clips) and insert the other end of the tubing into a second elbow stem fitting.
Insert the elbow stem fitting into the “Brine In” port of the pump.

text: Install permeate pump mounting clip onto the RO system manifold If the RO manifold is not pre-drilled for the permeate pump mounting clip, it will be necessary to drill the manifold to hold the mounting clip in place. Hold the mounting clip in the desired location (the tubing lengths provided in these instructions apply when the pump is mounted on the front/left of the RO manifold) and use a permanent marker to mark the hole locations. The mounting clip should have included mounting screws. Use the appropriate sized drill bit to drill the holes in the manifold. NOTE:  To avoid damaging the filter sump located behind the new hole locations, remove the filter sumps before drilling. Slide the pump into the mounting clip from the side. Ensure that you have the “Brine Out” and the “Permeate Out” ports toward the top of the pump. Turn the entire system around so that the back of the RO systems is facing you.  Remove both end of the tubing that runs from the permeate port of the membrane housing to ASO (Auto Shut-Off) valve. In order to remove the tubing from the Push-In connector, you need to press and hold in the collet ring and simultaneously pull out the tubing. NOTE:  Forcibly removing the tubing without holding in the collet ring is likely to damage the connector or the tubing, or both. This could cause leaks. Insert one end of a 22” section of tubing into the permeate port of the membrane housing, and run the tubing around to the front of the system and insert the other end of the tubing into the “Permeate In” port of the pump.  Attach an elbow stem fitting (facing up) into the “Permeate Out” port of the pump.  Insert one end of a 15” section of tubing into the elbow stem fitting of the “Permeate Out” port of the pump, and insert the other end of the tubing into the open port of the ASO valve  Locate the flow restrictor, and insert one end of a 22” section of tubing into the flow restrictor, and run the tubing around to the front of the system (using the guide holes in the mounting clips) and insert the other end of the tubing into a second elbow stem fitting.  Insert the elbow stem fitting into the “Brine In” port of the pump.  The installation is complete.
